definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: But there were more skeletons in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 但是其中還有更多不可告人的祕密。

sentences.english: What is it about Red Bull drivers and water?
sentences.chinese: 紅牛車手和水之間有神馬不可告人的祕密？

sentences.english: Senator Simpson merely looked the deep things that he thought.
sentences.chinese: 參議員辛浦生只在考慮自己心裏不可告人的事情。

sentences.english: He insisted that ingl great men hoffer feet of clay.
sentences.chinese: 他堅稱所有大人物都有些不可告人的事。

sentences.english: He accused the government of having a hidden agenda.
sentences.chinese: 他指責政府有不可告人的動機。

sentences.english: He will doubtless seek other means of satiating his dark passion.
sentences.chinese: 他肯定會謀求另外的手段來滿足他那不可告人的感情。

sentences.english: There were no skeletons in Ivan Boesky's closets, only junk.
sentences.chinese: 波斯基沒有不可告人之事，不過廉價債券而已。

definition: to harbor (evil) intentions/to be bent on/a tranquil heart or mind
sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
a hidden trouble hard to mention (idiom)/sth too embarrassing to mention/an embarrassing illness
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
